text: I love this place regardless of what anyone says....i love their pizza...i love their pizza...fit my taste bud reminds me of back.home in hk a place down the block from my house.

The pizza is pretty good, though not great. They do always have your pizzas ready on time, however, and generally how you asked for them. I was a little peeved when I shelled out $75 on 3 x-larges, and they all came shabbily cut in triangles instead of squares.  The bonus is they do have anchovies!

Was very apprehensive about getting pizza from this local joint but turned out to be completely wrong. Bubbly crust, delicious cheese, perfect amount of sauce. Plus free 1 liter with a large pizza! Only takes 15-20 minutes to make. Amazing!
Love me a good deep dish but this place met and exceeded what I wanted out of a thin crust. Would definitely go back; can't wait to.
Our go to pizza place in uptown. No frills kind of a place. Pizza is quite tasty. Thin crust.

This is my favorite Pizza joint in town. If pizza is what you want, this is the place to be at. The service is prompt, but in the late night the front personnel are like drug addicts. They can't speak, slurring their words not being able to understand them, don't comprehend, you have to repeat your order. The 2 skinny ladies are the worst I think they be high off pills.

The pizza is first rate if you really like New York style pizza.  It really is great crust.  The neighborhood is absolute hell, but I like it that way!  I've been going to this place for close to 30 years.  They recently remodeled it and it needed it bad.  The neighborhood is starting to come around.  The train station across the street has a huge renovation going on within the old historic structure.  The pizza by the slice is super cheap and enough for a meal.

They are remodeling, the owner is a jokster. Gotta love him. They are always friendly when you walk thru the door. Italian beef sandwiches are always amazing as well as their lasagnas. Stop by if your in uptown this place is sooo good.
I have been coming all the way from the south side of the city to get this wonderful pizza. My parents favorite pizza spot! Bit small place, but the pizza is one of a kind.

Lets face it. Uptown is just not a good neighborhood for food, unless you want asian. There are plenty of quality Pho spots, a few good Chinese places and Bale for Banh Mi. Order any other type of food and your risk factor for dissapointment goes up significantly.  I have seen and heard through the grapevine that Gigio's is pretty bomb. I used to eat there back in the day and I do not remember it being so great. Did they change? So I decided to head there and check it out. Yeah it is the same crummy pizza that I remember. Nothing seems fresh, the Tomato Sauce has no punch, the Sausage is forgettable. It's not Sarpino's bad but it's just not good pizza.  Yet what's really bad is it could still be the best pizza in Uptown. Rosati's Pizza I don't even acknowledge as pizza, Godfather Pizza is rather vomit inducing. Can my fellow yelpers please name a decent pizza spot in Uptown?   Oh and for those claiming it's the best NY Style Pizza in Chicago I say Bullarky! That distinction belongs to Jimmy's Pizza Cafe. In addition to all this unpleasant crummy pizza talk a couple of the guys in the back were arguing/threatening each other about tips I think. Ehhh, the neighborhood is still not so great, the pizza is not so great so I shouldn't expect more among worker attitudes. If the pizza was great I wouldn't care but it wasnt. I'm very dissapointed.

Favorite pizza in Uptown without question. They just remodeled so it's actually kind of nice now to hang out and grab a slice.  With all the construction going on at the Wilson Red line stop they have probably been hurting, so go in there now and show them some love.  Pizza orders come with a liter of RC cola, and slices are cheap and ready in a few minutes. Delivery is fast and friendly.

I fell in love with Gigio's Pizzeria during my first visit. The pizza was huge, NY style slice, and tasted great! The taste reminded me of Papa John's pizza, which led me to ordering another huge slice of it. Gigio's isn't a fancy pizza place, but it does do the job, and the place is decent enough to dine in at, but not big enough for big groups. I'm assuming most that order from Gigio's Pizzeria live in the Uptown neighborhood, and are long time customers. Most I'm assuming order takeout, or stop in while in the area, but for the looks of it; I don't think it gets very crowded.  As for pizza; Gigio's Pizzeria is one of the gems in the Uptown neighborhood, and looks like it has been around for years.  As for location, it sits within 200 meters from CTA Wilson, Harry S Truman College, and right on the strip next to Uptown Bikes. If you are ever in the area, its worth stopping in for a slice; maybe two or three : )
I love the pizza at this place, however I always seem to get rude ppl who take my order. I absolutely hate being rushed off the phone especially when I have questions.

NY style slices on one of the better crusts I've had, but not quite as good as some other spots. I enjoyed Gigio's. I thought they did a great job at getting pretty close to that NY flavor, which really starts with the sauce. It fell a tad short, but overall I was decently impressed. You know the drill: grab a triangle, fold it, and eat. There was some flop, but not enough that you couldn't hold it one-handed. They got it down here. It surprisingly wasn't too greasy and didn't take away from the balance of toppings. No frills spot for a slice or delivery. It is everything you'd expect from an old school hole-in-the-wall joint. Walking and grab a slice.

We just moved to uptown in May and this quickly became our go to pizza place. The pizza is delicious and recently the storefront itself has started to undergo renovations (much like the neighborhood around it). No frills for sure, but you'll get excellent pizza every time!

O M G!!!! Two stars for the embarrassing service in front of my colleagues. If we had not been hungry and knew the area we would have kept walking to find another place!! Pizza was ok, first time going and trying it out (cheese and spinach) but my colleague ordered pepperoni and sausage and it did not look appetizing. To only find a black round ball half way into eating. Disgusted she asked for another and of course there were excuses but the guy complied in the end, yet tossed it on the counter to her after it was cooked. HUGE argument between the pizza maker and manager. Didn't even care there were people coming in to order. They were all looking at one another wondering what was happening and if they should stay. NOT GOING AGAIN!!!

One star for the service!! The service is horrible the lady who takes the orders doesn't even let you finish with your order when she's already hanging up on you. It's a shame because Gigios was the pizza place for me since the late 80's. But their customers service is horrible, they should really remove that lady with the raspy voice out of there. The food over all is good not as good as before but still good. Due to poor customer service they lost a long time costumer.
Great old school Italian joint to grab a slice if you're ever in the Uptown area. Cheap and quick and true NYC style pizza. Enjoy.

Ive been coming to gigios since 2004-05 and i love their pizza its my favorite in uptown along with Michaels on broadway and belle plaine. It used to be  a hole in a wall but i see they are remodeling the front of the building and restaurant .its actually kinda nice shout out to lety who works behind the counter and the cooks. I always get medium pizza special for 10.80. They have good fried mushrooms and chicken as well
Whether you wanna taste a delicious Italian beef or you want to eat a good slice of pizza, this is the right place where to go.  You'll be satisfied for sure, stay away from the imitations!!

I'll start off by saying I have yet to try their pizza.   I saw the great reviews and since I live so close by I decided to check it out.  As I walked close to the door I could here what sounded to be a huge argument.  I hesitated a moment because our neighborhood can sometimes be interesting.  I looked inside and I saw the young lady behind the counter yelling at another employee at the top of her lungs.  She looked crazed. Needless to say I wanted no part of getting in the middle of this.  Not a great first impression.  You may want to teach them professionalism.

So three months ago I had a bad experience  and posted but because gigos has been my spot for years I wasn't going to let that one experience ruin my love for pizza and plus their delivery girl is the best so what the heck I'll try again. Well this time u ordered my Pizza and the new girl comes to the counter some Asia girl she had one a shirt that only covered the front boobs area you could see her torn black lace bra and her stomach was hanging out as well as she is walking around where the food is prepared in some nasty flip flops she turned my stomach. I canceled my order and went to Rosati down the street please I know your in Uptown but stop hiring the Uptown junkies this is crazy.

It wasn't bad. It just wasn't that good either. Sauce and crust were very bland. The folks in store were super friendly and my food was ready in a timely manner. It's not that I wouldn't eat here again, it just wouldn't be my first choice.
Great thin crust sausage. I've ordered it many times and it's a consistent win. FYI carryout is a must -- seating area/general interior is very unpleasant and their delivery service is inconsistent.

Another great place whose rating is ruined by dummies. Gigio's isn't gourmet. At these low, low prices, you know they're not using the best ingredients. It's a slice shop, not some newfangled we grow our own tomatoes with love BS pizza restaurant.  For classic thin crust pizza, Gigio's is great. Be sure to get the sausage! As for the dummies I spoke of, read through the reviews. Most of the negative reviews have to do with  delivery orders. I have no experience to speak of on that one, but the solution here is easy: Don't be lazy and go pick up your own pizza.

Awesome! Was looking for a new place near me for good pizza and am so happy I wound up with Gigio's! Awesome thin crust NY style pizza, and delivery guy was really nice. I will definitely be ordering again!

Was hungry for lunch so I stopped on by for a slice and I love supporting little mom and pop joints around the city! They had one of those big slice and a pop deals for around $5 and some change. I went with the sausage and pepperoni and it was pretty good. Nothing special but a good place to grab a slice if you are Uptown.

I went there yesterday around 4pm, the register guy was not right person to take care of customer. Did not bring menu, water either. Even more he was talking on the phone and hosting the table.  The waitress was really nice, but I was feel so bad to the host. I don't know he is the owner or just host, but obviously I won't do this service to customer. This is first time to having bad service in Andersonville.
Great pizza! It's the only place I order pizza from when I'm craving a simple pie....Next best thing to a NYC slice.

Best pizza in Chicago binge eating there ever since I could barely walk good people good ingredients good service the places in Uptown so the neighborhood is kind of weird if you know what I mean but its getting better
Just waited a hour and a half for a slice of pizza and mozzarella sticks that was a waste of the mere 22 dollars but o well now I know I won't have to be choosing those place again.

I love my favorite combo from Gigio's, mushrooms, sausage, onions and garlic. The juiciness under the cheese layer makes me salivate just contemplating it. However, the customer service sometimes is a bit rough around the edges and for some reason they always try to upsell me to a medium pie. I have to point out that a small Gigio's special is $16 and change and that I don't want to pay $20 for a medium just for myself. It means I can't really order on the phone because they just charge me for a medium. What leaves me truly incredulous is that in the end I get a medium sized pie anyways, even if I only paid for a small. I can't tell if they're hustling me or just have a good reason for refusing to make small pies. It is quite frankly frustrating, and gives me a bad feeling about the two guys who cook the pies. One of them actually called me cheap one night. The only reason I go back is for the pizza.

This is an institution! Been a Gigio's customer since I was barely able to speak. Parents and grandparents used to take us in for a slice and a pop. Turns out my husband that I met 22 years later grew up right around the corner from Gigio's and he had the same experience. We now live in Edgewater and visit Gigio's at least every other week.  Dine in or pick is best, not the same if not piping hot - delivery is hit or miss. This is not a place that cares about customer service - they tell it like it is and we deal with it - the pizza is that good. In 30 plus years I have never had anything but pizza there so cannot comment on anything else. Sausage is the best. Great prices and real cheese! This is not a first date place- your lucky to find a clean table, and it is usually filled with some scary people but overall worth it for the pizza. Its Chicago at its best and Uptown at its core.  We are worried with all the changes in the area, we hope it does not mean the end of Gigio's. I am in Real Estate and love change for the better, but I love to see history and landmarks keep their spot on our row of legendary streets. Fight to keep some of our spots by being good patrons and shopping/dining locally. Gigio's is a great start - do not be frightened by the outside or the less than clean floors (never use their bathroom), the kitchen is where the magic happens and you can see it is clean and the same people have been making the pies for literally decades - quality quality quality! Love you Gigio's!!!

Gigio's Pizzeria Has fantastic pizza, there New York Style pizza has just the right amount of cheese and sauce, a little more on the greasy side, but not too bad. Typically i prefer Pepperoni over sausage, but there's is more tolerable than any I've had anywhere else. Theres a few things that need changing though, an update on the aesthetics and decor, but they have authentic feel regardless, paper plates and RC Cola, gives it that old school feel to it. If you our a lover of pizza and want to try some New York style pizza living in Chicago's North side this is the place to go!
Hot. Circle. Of. Garbage. Pizza is so gross. Shady loiterers stand out front all evening. I have witnessed drug dealing out front. Do not go here. No. No. No.

NY style pizza is my favorite kind, and gigio's makes a pretty solid one. If you ask to make it extra thin, they'll do exactly that. Don't go expecting some gourmet pizza establishment, expect a greasy and absolutely delicious slice of love.
Delicious and also by the slice! Awesome joint. The people are down to business. Delivery is friendly.

Long day of moving into our new apartment in Edgewater. Was told we'd wait 40 minutes to an hour. Two hours later, after already checking in with them and being assured it was on the way, they tell us there was no record of our order. The girl on the phone was very nice and apologetic, said we'd be a priority, and said we'd get our sodas for free. I figured after such a goof-up we should get the whole thing free. I'm put on with the manager, who seems to imply I'm scamming them. After an unpleasant conversation I get $5 off. Another hour later we get our pizza. The soda order was wrong and we received our pizza in squares, even though I ordered it sliced, three times throughout the ordeal.  Pizza was okay. The girl was very nice when they made the mistake. But the combo of incompetence and the whatever food has got me taking time to write a bad Yelp review, which I don't like doing.

I ordered through Seamless. From order placement to delivery took two hours!!! I ordered at 7:20 with an 8:25-8:35 delivery window. At 8:35 I called the restaurant to see if the order had left the restaurant and all I got was "it's on its way, honey." Then, at 8:50 I called again and was put on the phone with a manager who said to call back when our food arrives to receive a discount. The pizza didn't arrive until 9:15, and the driver compensated with a bottle of ginger ale, as if that would heat up the COLD PIZZA he just delivered. When I called pack to receive the discount, all that was offered was a credit for the next time I ordered through them, when I'd rather have received a refund. As for the food, it would have been great if it hadn't been room temperature by the time it arrived! I'm not sure if I'm willing to give Gigio's a second chance.

I have been coming here/ordering from here since I was a kid.... Now a days the place has gotten so bad I don't even sit down to wait for my food. The pizza is great,  the wings were good and the fries were delicious. We actually didn't expect them to be that good. We ordered from grub hub so luckily we didn't have to deal with the bad customer service we read about, but I witnessed it once that I went to pick up a pizza. So far we've had a good experience
45 minutes late, pizza was cool AND undercooked, called the guy back for an update and he could barely put a sentence together. Overall bad experience, don't waste your time
Gelatinous muck. Call ORD Pizzeria...free delivery and 1000% times better.
Very mediocre pizza at sky-high gourmet pizza prices.  Cardboard tasteless crust, cheap cheese, mediocre sauce.  A large pie with two standard ingredients is close to $25.  Definitely go elsewhere.

The place is filthy, the phone people can be rude and the toppings (other than pepperoni) are canned and not very delicious. However, the pizza can be pretty damn good sometimes. Occasionally it's greasy and not as good.      Only order cheese pizza or pepperoni.  East coast transplants should try it for sure.

Great place to go to if you're craving some pizza, but don't want to get the whole pie. Pizza is sold by the slice and they also have a gigantic slice as well for a few more dollars. Service is quick and pizza is delicious. Good for late-night pizza cravings. I haven't tried anything other than the pizza, but I eventually will

Hands down my favorite lazy day food. This is the best NY style pizza I've had in Chi yet. Delivery takes about 45 minutes to an hour, costs $3 extra, and usually comes with a free liter of RC.  I am stuck on the sausage--it's amazing and perfect. Gigio's doesn't skimp on the cheese, and the sauce is a little sweet, a perfect counterbalance to the sausage. I usually get a large since it's just as good reheated.  Placing phone orders is usually a little stressful, as it always seems like the person on the other end must be standing in the middle of a battlefield, so I usually order from Grub Hub to avoid yelling my credit card info over the phone. The storefront is on Broadway near Wilson and pretty divey. I wouldn't hang out there.
We waited over two hours for delivery and the pizza and wings were cold (and nothing special taste wise). The restaurant did not offer any form of refund...won't be ordering from here again!

Great New York style pizza. I hadn't found anything close to this since moving to Chicago. Chicago's idea of New York style is some Pizza Hut crap, that is not this. This is good, authentic, greasy pizza. You fold it up and eat it with your hand, not a knife and fork.

They are always solid on delivery. And frequently bring a comped RC cola bottle.  Friendly delivery people and their pizza reheats well. It has a slightly sweet flavor to the tomato sauce that I like. This is for if you are in the mood for thin crust. This is not Chicago style pizza, not even close.  It is always a hit at parties too, it flies off the table.  No frills, but no complaints.

I fell in love with the sausage and mushroom slices all over again as soon as I tasted it I'm my car. sort of flexible but dry tasty crust (not greasy till u let it sit around) with a generous amount of topping. excellent meat flavor and amazing sauce with balanced italian spice, though could have put more garlic. but hey I'm a garlic fiend so. big new york size slices and flavor the way pizza should be. some place's pizzas are just swimming in grease. not olive oil, grease, I don't understand that concept. u know the places, they cut the pizza into squares, not for me thanx. gigios put their slices in the old school brown paper bag. so don't be alarmed when u get it home and the bag is scarily greasy. u don't taste that or really feel it in your mouth. the brown bag does what it's made to do, wick away the grease. if a pizza doesn't have some trace oil like the olive oil they use, then it's NOT pizza it's some US cheap ripoff. I've been eating pizza there since childhood (like my parents) and it looks exactly the same and the slices taste the same. the big MISTAKE that people make is ordering the whole pizzas, like the large, during certain times when certain guys aren't working. or when u see mostly females working. I made that mistake ONCE and the pizza was a big bland mess. I actually had to throw most of it out cause even my friend who's a bigger eater than me couldn't finish his portion. yep, that bad. so I talked to the big guy that's always sitting when running the register because I know him from constantly frequenting gigio's. and was told like I heard a long time ago the same thing: if he ain't here or so and so ain't running this or that it might be 'hummmm a little different'. the last part said with a wink and a laugh. it's the kind of place that if u haven't been there before and are going past it maybe to go to the army surplus store or the bike shop u might be scared away by the kinda run down decor. but you'll always see a good amount of people in it most of the time crowds. even in the blistering heat of the summer with only some old rusty shop fans blowing. the SLICES are that good

Consistently excellent NY style pizza. Yes, it's a bit of a hole in the wall with sometimes sketchy clientele hanging around, but I think it adds to the ambience of the place (and I typically order it for carry out or delivery anyway). Nothing fancy. No frills. Just a good slice.
Two words: Canned mushrooms. Yuck. Won't order from here again.

Pizza was fabulous. The sauce is sweeter and the crust is crunchy and flabby in all the right places. Topping weighing in a competitive amount with the cheese. It's pretty spectacular when you get the bill too. My only complaints are :the girl who took the order- sounded like she hated her job  And I got orange Faygo...yes orange, instead of Ginger Ale- possibly a result of unhappy girl? Maybe? Maybe not? The sweet delivery guy offered to go exchange it, but I knew it wasn't his mistake or at the very least, personal...I sighed inside and kindly thanked but declined. Any who, pizza is the cats arse for the price you pay, I just feel like I'm at a 10 year old pool party with orange pop.

Used to love this place used to be great Key phrase  Used to Now I don't know if there's new management or lack of giving a damn But the place seems to have gone horribly down hill  Last time I went in the guy behind the counter was filthy and had nasty hands so I said no thanks and moved along  Time before this one I ordered what I usually do happy with the deal I had gotten till I got home and tasted it  I was sorely disappointed  and upset ketchup on card board would be better than this and It didn't used to be this way what ever is going on they need to fix and get the nasty homeless looking guy from behind the counter  How disgusting  time and money wasted i thew over 90% away I couldn't put my taste buds and stomach through the punishment. Tried to give another chance but that nasty guy behind the counter sent me packing EWWWE no !!! Just no !!

Not good at all! I called in an order and the woman on the phone didn't take down any of my info except my address. So when the driver showed up and I wanted to pay with my card, I had to go find an atm, really come on!!! I called back to talk to the owner and he just put me back on the line with the same girl. Are you kidding me??!! The pizza I got was not worth all that trouble, super greasy and no flavor. Will never recommend this place or ever order from here again. Bad food and even worse customer service.

My family has order from this place and honestly the quality has changed a bit, if your looking for bite of greasy ish pizza or yummy italian beef or etc.decent food , somewhat decent prices . customer service needs to be fixed, issues of repeating orders, credit card number, being put on hold. Drivers. I was glad they have online ordering available and I didn't have to call to order so I decided to order online for a italian beef sandwich,followed with a coupon of italian beef combo with fries and a drink and meat ravioli.  Time quoted 4:18pm.. Couple minutes after..a driver calls and has trouble finding my house...driver not only has a lady in the car but she agruing that theres no address.I said I've ordered from here before and never had a  problem.so  the driver tell his female company that she (me)never had a problem with her address..(um..what).I stood on my porch and greet him and he said the sun was so bright, the number of my house looked like a blur....right. Then he leaves my outer gate wide open.. I take in my food, hot french fries in a bag with napkins and plastic sliverware on top of hot bag of french fries(smart people) and come to find out my meat ravioli was missing.I called and stated my meat ravioli was not in the food that was delivered to me... Guy basically says he gotta wait for his driver to get back and he will have to look at my order to see if meat ravioli was ordered because he was the one who wrote the order. (Right I'm gonna call to get something I didnt order in the first place)I told him I didnt want the same driver and explain what happened. . No call of apologizing or letting me know my food is being delivered. Got my meat ravioli. . Bottom line, maybe would order again but theres other options in chicago

It's a hole-in-the-wall NYC style pizza place. And I love it.  It's basically the Harold's Chicken of pizza. No frills (especially when it comes to the interior decorating), just good junk food.  Giant slices, good prices, and quick service... What more do I need in my go-to pizza by the slice place?
Good pizza. Good price. Fast service. I'm sure that I will be using this restaurant as my takeout pizza from now on.

The food was a 2, the service was a -10.  When calling the person asking for my order cut me off at the pizza I was ordering.  I was actually going to order more but was cut off after the pizza.  When I asked to order more, I got a sigh and a "hold on".    I repeated my credit card number two times and she wasn't getting it.  She then had to call back asking for the number a third.  It gets better..... The food came and the driver forgot the receipt.  I then had to give him a $5 and ask for cash back.  About 20 minutes later the same lady calls back asking for the card number again.  She repeats what she had the first time, which was incorrect.  I read it two more times and told her that I would like to speak to the manager.  She declined to let me speak to anyone else there. By the end of the call, she is screaming my credit card number at me.  If you have driven by this place, you know why that isn't a good idea. I appreciate people need to work but this was the worst customer service i have ever experienced, mediocre food, and $35.80 with tip.  Do yourself a favor, want to be treated crapy, go to Wiener Circle.
being from chicago... i was the black sheep for not diggin traditional chicago pizza... i  my nyc style and gigios was it for me... always been the best since the 80s... keep it up

Really good NYC style pizza . Growing up on the east coast , I  always loved the thin crust with the charred bottom. I live on the north side , so Gigios  is my place to go .. But if I'm near the wicker park area , Santullo's is awesome !
This pizza is so good! It's fresh and hot and melty with the perfect amount of sauce! I love it! Yum yum yum!

This place needs to be cleaned up. It was run down and made me re-think ordering a pizza. The service is terrible and the pizza was bland and greasy. In addition, something tells me they just don't care about the neighborhood or the customers.

I'm from Philadelphia so the whole deep dish appeal is lost on me. Gigio's is authentic East Coast pizza. Hand tossed, thin crust, foldable. I haven't eaten anything else from there, but I order pizza once a week and have rarely been disappointed. I wouldn't recommend eating there, it's small, chaotic, and HOT.

They make a solid NY slice, and the service is salty. The pizza can't hold its structure, so two hands are required, and its loaded with cheese. I got a gnarly pizza last night with sausage, pepperoni, sausage, and shrimp. The shrimp was those little thumb-sized guys, but the flavor was there. I haven't had any problems with delivery times as some other reviewers expressed.

Look Gigio's is what it is a hole in the wall dive! but they sell the most amazing pizza!! that you ever tasted. I been eating  this  pizza since i was twelve years old; and i m still eating here and  i m 55 now.All i'm saying if you truly want New York Style Pizza with a wonderful taste give this place a try you wont be disappointed.  P.S the neighborhood is scary so get it to go or delivery

Had this pizza for the first time over the weekend.  We ordered a large sausage and pepperoni and a large pepper, onion and olive.  Both were very good.  I like that it's a dry crust (I hate greasy pizza).  I am a huge fan of sausage pizza.  Best sausage on a pizza ever!  So good!  We did pick up.  It's your typical pizza place...a few booths that have been there from the 80's and simple decor.  They serve RC/Dr. Pepper products.  So, I think that should tell you the type of place your going to.  Let's be honest, when you go somewhere that serves RC Cola, you know what you're walking into.  Our pizza was ready when we got there and we got our free pop (RC baby!) with the pizza.  However, I found it a little odd that the women at the register was eating...at the register while working.  But, the place was clean so I just went with it.  Oh, and apparently they do good wings too.  There was a guy who downed a large pizza and a plate of wings and fries by himself while we were there.  Impressive and scary all at the same time.   But, in the end, it's all about the pizza.  And they do good pizza!

This is a New York-style pizzeria. I mean that n many senses. Yes, they serve New York-style pizza by the slice (and it's pretty good fresh). But the shop is dingy and worn, and that stretch of Broadway (Chicago's Broadway, mind you) reminds you of New York as well--not Manhattan, but the crummy part of Brooklyn. You can't complain about the authenticity, though!
A staple in Uptown Chicago and still one this cities wonders. So get fimiliar ASAP. My name is Bishop and I approve this message.

I feel mean giving 1 star, but this was the only time I haven't been able to finish a piece of pizza. It wasn't exactly gross,  it just tasted like cardboard! I paid 30 dollars for a large pizza and cheese bread and the pizza had absolutely no flavor and the cheese bread was one of those frozen totinas pizza boats! I am just really confused about the 4 yelp stars. How??

I am not a huge pizza fan but will get hit with random cravings for an occasional greasy slice. I keep a running list of neighborhood places I want to try when such a craving hits, and Gigio's topped that list based on recs from friends who grew up with Gigio's, or have been loyal fans for years. I was disappointed, and disappointed to be disappointed! The mozzarella sticks were fine (the marinara sauce, HORRIBLE- runny and watery). Our large sausage/mushroom pie was also fine. But I mean, that was it- I wouldn't even use the word "good." Just fine.  I think I've had better pizza from Domino's.

The pizza is really good.  The service is horrible.  When I called the woman said square or slices.  I said I just want a round, which she responded with irritation, "So you don't want it cut?" Obviously she just wanted to give me a hard time.  So when ordering if you would like a round pizza, it is called slices... Then, when I was signing the receipt for the delivery man, it took me a minute because I was holding my 3 month old son and he rolled his eyes at me!   On a separate occasion my husband called and said the woman was so rude that he did not want to give the place any business.  Overall, if you don't mind horrible customer service, go for it.
I am from NY and this is pretty darn close to NY pizza, the crust could be a bit better but over all great. The mozzarella sticks are awesome too.

It was my first time ordering from Gigio's and will be the last. Not only did it take an hour and 45 min for me to get 5 appetizers and a few sodas, I didn't get the soda I ordered, they brought 1 wrong flavor, they forgot the cheese for the fry's, and they were rude. I called the restaurant and all they said was "it's on the way" then hung up on me. Their food is awful and so is their service. They need to take more pride in the food they serve or they will continue to disappoint customers until they close their doors. If you want to call yourself a restaurant then serve edible food. I will never forgive laziness, Please give up if you continue to provide food that my dog won't eat.

Pro: The best cheese "plain" NY style pies I've found in Chicago. Great deal for take out medium pies and great for slices. Cons: Disgusting canned vegetable toppings. When we ordered it with Jalapenos it was just plain gross and we couldn't eat the pizza. I can't speak for the meat toppings as I'm a vegetarian.

This is the pizza place where I likes to keep it simple. Cheese, pepperoni, or sausage. That is it. No extra ingredient. It ruined few pizza I ordered.  This is a dive pizza joint. Stick to the basic and you will get a delicious pizza. greasy? I likes it. When I crave a nice thin crust pizza that is greasy and delicious, I go here.  Minus 1 star b/c there is a 20% (w/e it's %) that the quality of the pizza changes from time to time. I have my fair shares of subpar pizza from Gigio. Sometime the cheese is missing one extra type of cheese. Sometime it's over cook.  Overall, it's a good pizza joint and I have been a customer of theirs for maybe 15yr. I tried pizza from literally everywhere in Chicago but it's the nice greasy pizza that keep me craving for it from time to time.

Hey, I don't lie, I had pizza from here before and  I LOVE THIS PIZZA PLACE!! but why the low rating, you might ask? With this third visit, I have come to a conclusion, I will NEVER visit this stupid place again!  In this place you will find the worst service you could get, and it is always this dumb old lady that treats me and the rest of the costumers the same way. Hey, I don't care if she is an employee, a manager or a owner, you DO NOT treat costumers like that. Here an example of one of my epic visits. I call, she picks up.  I order delivery, she tells me she can't hear me. I speak louder, she can hear me now but now she don't understand me.  I speak more clearly, she tells me she doesn't understands, she hangs up.  I call AGAIN, to place a simple delivery order. She picks up. I start my order ONCE more, she tells that if I call, I need to know what I want to order (like if I had the damn menu on my hands to read), she tells me to hurry up placing the order. I had a pause, ( I was literally shocked at her behavior!) *she breaths*. She tells me "okay" and hangs up once more. Really?!  Hey Gigio's guy, if you want to keep your place open, train your employees for customer service skills.  Because as for me, I know I have WAY better options and I know for sure they won't treat me the same.  PS. If you get attended by a lady in her 20's you'll definitely will have another and very pleasant experience.

Local Pizza enthusiast..gives it 2(ok) I would give it 3 but... Pros: Thin crust-foldable NY style, chewy, perfect cheese amount. Good street fast food  Cons: I am forcing myself its good, but "bland" got the giant slice-combo w/can of pop. Under $7.00. Needs flavor, sauce & sausage...had to add parm cheese, red pepper flakes, garlic powder...it helped...if the price $5.00 combo w/pop...three stars and would go back, hey it is fast food...what do you expect...not "gourmet level" pizza

Yelp, it is not often you fail me.  Today you have done that. This pizza is TERRIBLE.  Bland sauce, bland toppings, just nothing at all about this pizza was good.  What's left of my delivery is going in the trash.  Unless you think the cardboard box tastes good, don't order from here.

So good!  This is great pizza!  It's not expensive and it is good, tasty, and perfect for a night in.  My husband and I don't order any other pizza anymore.  They have a 2 pizza minimum for delivery, and the medium size is more like a large.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that it isn't great left over.

Lets be serious, when you read a review about his place that uses the words "The best pizza in town" you know they're lying. The Pizza is cardboard thin and so full of grease it literally drips off, it coats everything to the point is absurd. There is nothing about this pizza, either from the toppings to the crust that stands out, nothing. The place is a dive that has clearly been neglected. Dirty windows, bugs and rubbish all over the floor, a rude staff and a sub par menu make this place utterly forgettable.  If you're starving and in the mood for greasy pizza check it out, if you're really interested in a good pizza that tastes good go somewhere else.

Hands down, the best New York Style Pizza in Chicago!! My boyfriend introduced me to this pizza joint when we first started dating 4 years ago. His family have been customers of Gigios's since he was a kid! They have amazing fresh cut fries and their pizza is to die for. Great little Cozy spot to eat in the staff and cook are so friendly. :)

On our way back into the city so asked my iPhone for a listing of Good Pizza shops. Gigio's was first. After waiting it seemed forEver for the pizzas, but one bite made it all worth while. This is what GOOD tasting pizza is all about.
Your average dive-looking pizza joint but the pizza is really good as NY style pizzas go. Tasty and a decent deal for the $9 pizza.
definitely the best ny slice ive had in chicago.  and very high on the old school character scale.

I'll keep it short and sweet.  Hands down, the best NY style pizza in Chicago.  Just another example of dont judge a book by its cover.  This is a hole in the wall joint in a somewhat sketchy area but seriously grab a slice if youre in the area.

I was born and raised in Chicago, and always enjoy discovering new, delicious pizza around the city, all the way to the south side. My boyfriend and I moved to Uptown a few months ago and we keep trying new pizza places around the neighborhood. I saw so many great reviews on Yelp for this place, so I told my boyfriend we had to try it... uuummmmm..... first bite I took I thought, hmmm, maybe I got a bad bite since I don't taste much of anything. Nope, no flavor. We had just mushrooms on top, and even the mushrooms had absolutely no taste. They were watery and seemed like they came from a can. You'd think the tomato sauce would have some taste to it tho, NOPE. nadda. seriously.  Even tho it was only $9 for a 14 inch, which is super cheap and awesome. I will never go back and tell all my friends to not even try it. Lamest, flavorless, blah pizza I've ever ever had.  I would have preferred a slice from a school cafeteria rather than this place. Save your money!!!!!!!!
Best pizza place in Chicago. Awful part of town. But awesome pizza.

From the amazing storefront, to the quintessential Italian-American mustached, pizza chef illustration, to an amazing NY Slice, Gigio's surely does it right.  Speaking about doing things right, this spot also reminds me of Sal's Pizzeria in Spike Lee's 'Do the Right Thing', without the wall of fame.  One of the best NY Slices, not only in Uptown, but possibly throughout the entire city.
YES YES YES-NY slice of pizza. May not be the fanciest place, but hey there pizza is a home run. Slice of cheese $2.90 yes please

Just moved to the area and I was trying to find a good pizza joint....THIS IS IT. My search is over.  So... From the outside and inside of the place, it looks like a total dump, but who cares, as long as the food is awesome, right? Right. The pizza rocks. I've never really had pizza that tasted so yummy! It's SO affordable! I was able to feed myself and my boyfriend twice on less than $10! I wouldn't really wanna eat inside the place, since it's super hot and there's some very suspicious people, but I'd get it delivered/picked up. Good thing I only live a couple minutes away! I recommend it! Cheap prices and great food!

Surprisingly good. Apparently they've been there forever. Mentioned to my mom that my wife and I got delivery from a place we'd never tried before, and she said, "Gigio's? I used to go there as a kid!" Delivery was fast, the toppings were of decent quality, and the Gigio's special is a pretty good deal. Better than any other thin crust in the area. Will definitely order from them again.
Come for a slice.  It is deliciously greasy and a deal for about $3.  It had really great flavor all around, but don't expect fine dining and you'll be fine.

Best pizza ever!!!!! I was raised on this pizza. My dad used to take me to the one in Evanston every Saturday when I was a kid. Now I'm lucky enough to live close to the one on Broadway.  When the pizza arrives (in a very satisfying amount of time - granted I live like 3 blocks away), it always looks so amazingly delicious. And the taste is even better. This is the type of joint that you pick up a pie or have it delivered. If you're hungry and happen to walk by, pop in for a single slice. I don't know who goes fine dining for pizza. I eat pizza when I want to stay home and be lazy. If you pick up they have an amazing deal for a 14" 1-topping pie for $9 (extra charge for additional toppings). I ALWAYS get pepperoni and spinach. I've tried A LOT of pizza in Chicago, and this is the best, hands down. I'm speaking in terms of hand-tossed/thin. Seriously, if you want a perfect pizza every time, you gotta go Gigio's.
This has to be the absolute BEST New York style slice in Chicago!!!  I'll definitely be a repeat visitor.

No complaints! Yelp never fails, highest rated for the neighborhood and rightly so. Not from around here and was happy with the pizza and the price. Arrived early, even though it was dinner time Friday night. Would definitely order from them again!

THIS is the pizza to which all other pizza must compare. If it doesn't, that's a problem.  Gigio's just gets it right. Nothing about this pizza tastes fake. It's almost indescribable, really. I've eaten a lot of pizza ever since I was a little girl growing up in Chicago and Gigio's will always be number one no matter where I go. This is city pizza baby. Flimsy paper plates, cornmeal-dusty crust, stretchy cheese and a little bit of grease to boot. Best sausage I've ever tasted. Not your processed brown balls like the ones you see on Little Ceasar's or Domino's slices. Pepperoni never has an aftertaste. They really do it right. The pizza's the main thing. If you ever want to branch out, the breaded mushrooms are yummy too.  In all the years I've frequented Gigio's service was great and we've always gotten our pizza steamy and hot. I miss those brown paper bags and the pizza/pop combo. It's true that it's not in the best neighborhood but like any place, you have to be aware of your surroundings. We've never had a problem carrying out or dining in there. This is a Chicago landmark that's been there for forever and it is so worth a visit.  Gigio's, please send a slice to Texas for me!
My favorite place in the city for pizza by the slice. Perfection. I dont know what these people are complaining about. Go to pizza hut you lames.

I don't know why people complain so much. Listen up snob. Walk up to the register and say "slice of sausage". Give the lady the $2.85 for the slice. It'll be ready in about 3 minutes. Put some red pepper flakes and maybe oregano on it. Enjoy. Then hop on the Red Line to wherever you need to be.  It's a hole in the wall pizza joint. What are you expecting? This is Uptown.

best thin slice/nyc style pizza on the northside of chicago and possibly in the whole city. Get the sausage, its their special recipe. Also, you have to get a slice of pizza or a large, if you get the smaller pizzas it doesnt taste right. It looks a luttle shoddy from the outside and inside but thats what you have to deal with to get some good thin crust in chicago.

As someone from the east coast: If you're looking for NYC-style pizza, this is it. Thin crust (NOT crunchy!), greasy, cheese everywhere, foldable, awesome. The prices are right, too. Very low.  As someone who used to live in uptown, though: I can tell you that its location is pretty sketch. It's not Englewood or anything, but you don't really want to be there after dark. Service at the place reflects the neighborhood they have to deal with.  So, if you've got the itch for real NY pizza without that real pre-Giuliani NY 'hood feel, get delivery. They've arrived about when they said they would (or before) every time I've ordered and the delivery people are pleasant.

Customer Service, Customer Service, Customer Service. If you're looking for a pizza joint and just have to have it "THIS PLACE AIN'T IT!" The pizza is still good enough to satisfy a craving but I don't frequent the place like I use to. I walked in and there were a few people behind the counter. They looked up, saw me and didn't greet me then I spoke and no one said a word. I went ahead and ordered 2 slices of sausage and a drink anyway. I stood there for a moment and finally had to ask the cashier how much it was. She was holding her hand out for money, but she never told me how much the order cost. I gave her a $20 and as she handed me back my change I asked her again how much it was and this time she told me with an attitude and rolled her eyes. I explained to her that I misunderstood her before. Anyway, now I'm aggravated and ready to just get the hell out of there. The guy walks up, shoves my bag onto the counter, no thank you, and I just take it and walk out. Now for me, this is the type of service that puts a bad taste in my mouth and I just wanna CUSS everybody out. But, I maintained and just told myself to never give into another craving and to look for another thin sliced pizza joint that's the bomb in my neighborhood. The infamous UPTOWN.
fast, cheap and easy for great BIG slices, AND opened late!

Sketchy yes.  Shitty atmosphere yes.  Good service? Not really, but who cares bc the pizza is cheap and as good as it gets if you are looking for authentic NY style pizza in the windy city!  An uptown gem I tell ya!  PS. The fries are fresh cut and surprisingly good too! Pizza Pizza!
HOT, cheesy and delicious.  we pick up a large cheese (with free soda) at least once a week.  add our own toppings at home and dig in.
Don't bother. Hung up on when put on hold trying to order. Said 30 minutes, it took an hour and 30 minutes. Sent the wrong soda. Pizza was cold.

Gigios has been in uptown forever . It's a greasy ass little whole in the wall. O have been eating Gigios since I had teeth. The pizza is good and greasy and great for a quick fix! I recommend just going in and getting a slice. The two star rating is for their customer service and delivery. It simply sucks. It took 5 min and several repeated answers on my part, just for the girl on the phone to understand my order......( large sausage)...I am a patient person, but after repeating my phone number and my credit card way too many times, I realized my order would be messed up, so I canceled it. This is not my first negative experience with Gigios, there have been several. One time the delivery driver, tried to make a duplicate copy of my credit card!! My advice is just get a slice to go, but if you must use the delivery use cash!!
Amazingly HOT, cheesy and delicious.  Beautifully textured crust (could use more salt), loaded fresh toppings, great sauce.  Great price and 22 min to get to my door.  Free soda with my large, fyi.

They made a pregnant lady wait an hour an a half for a pizza promised to be 45 minutes. Also, it was lukewarm and mediocre. But the first sentence should be enough to make you call someone else if you have a craving for cheap, greasy pizza.

I use to live in Brooklyn but born & raised in Chicago.  This pizza is excellent!  Get a slice and it's very filling!  The service here is terrible and rude but who cares, I just want a slice!  You also might want to stay away from the area late at night too.

Hole in the wall kind of place in a rough hood with frequent homeless people hanging around. I have been eating here for over 20 years. It was much better back then when the old man was alive.  Nowadays the pizza is still pretty good. the closest you can get for a NY style thin crust. Reasonably price and excellent thin crusts. Cheese and sauce are great.  If you don't mind the neighborhood.... great thin crust pizza to go. Ask for well done, IMO they taste better.

Aesthetically this place is as nearly tragic looking from the outside as it is on the inside, it's pretty dire.  But we're not talking look and feel, we're talking pizza. And this place has got it in taste spades.   Gigio's is consistently mentioned in any number of 'authentic NY Slices in Chicago' and for good reason.  They are in the top two imo.  The other. Dante's in the Square.   [x] Do it.
A bit doughy, not as NY as Cafe Luigi. That's all you need to know.

I grew up on Long Island and lived in NYC for many years before coming to Chicago.  This is the first and only pizzeria I have tried in Chicago that even comes close to NY pizza.  You fold your slice and little drops of grease from the sauce flow down the fold onto the wax paper.  Nothing like it.  For the downside, the place is dark and dingy and the neighborhood; not so much.  Also wish they had the variety of options you can find in NYC.  If you're looking for a real NY slice, Gigio's in Uptown is the place to go. Bravisimo.

Coming from New York City,  I haven't ever been thrilled about the pizza here in Chicago....20 years here and never found anything similiar to NY pizza...I have been passing this place for all 20 years of my time here and never gave the place a second thought because of the neighborhood and it looked like kind of a dive.  Tonight I had a spiritual experience after getting a XLarge Sausage Pepperoni pizza from Gigio's....It was almost perfect in my opinion and I will never buy pizza anywhere else....Thanks Carter for the recommendation...I owe you many thanks

Great price for great pizza! the service is gritty and the interior a bit dirty; just how I like my pizza joints (especially if it's 2am and I'm wasted).  The first time I came here I just wanted a jumbo slice, but they don't take credit cards for purchases under 5 dollars... so I ordered the medium sized pizza for $9 and ate 6 slices! The crust is more chewy and the cheese more stringy than I prefer, however, I like it, friends I take there like it and you'll like it!

This is the only pizzeria I can get my New York husband to order from. Be ready to order when you call or get hung up on... a little New Yorker in Chicago.  I recommend just the cheese or pepperoni and the other toppings are a little rough. I would give it 5 stars if it was in a better location.... we use delivery so we can pretend the place doesn't look as bad as it does....

I love the Gigio's in Evanston but this one is just a sad one in Chicago. Every time I order from here (which was quite a bit, I guess I was hoping I was going to get a different reaction) I got an attitude and a cold pizza. I know, I know, it must be me, right? But I've been sweet as pie (pun intended) I swear! Anyways, I've ordered a large plain cheese thin crust every time and for some reason their delivery takes longer than a deep dish from Giordanos! Guess I will have to look else where.

Not sure if i got this mixed up with the Gigio's in Evanston--which I have not been to--but I stopped in here on a Friday night hoping for some NY style pizza as noted in the reviews. First of all, the place is a shithole. I'm down with hole-in-the-wall places, but Gigio's was straight dirty. We ordered 4 slices and the man behind the counter had a lot of trouble handling this order for some reason. We had to talk through it several times before he got the order in correct and our order was still wrong when we got it.  As for the pizza; I think PapaJohn's is probably more New York than this. Was way too bready and despite the amount of cheese, it had zero flavor. The slices were small as well. Definitely not foldable. I have no clue why anyone would want to willingly eat here.
This is some of the best new york style pizza in the city. Really thin and really cheesy. I order it about once a week!

Jumbo slice with a free pop for $4.89. What a deal! They were nice enough to cut the slice for me so that I had one at night and the next for lunch the following day.  Delicious, fold up NYC style pizza. I've only ever had the sausage and have always been content with it.  Give it a try!
Yummmi love the pizza not the best looking place would't eat there but the pizza are great.
this has to be the best new york style pizza in the chicagoland area.

i really like this place... Well as much as you possibly can. I'm always amused by the phone service. it's like talking to an unmedicated bi-polar person. Some times they are sweet and friendly other times they are too busy screaming and swearing to actually take your order.  The pizza it self is probably the best NY style pizza you can find on the Northside and 90% of the time it is spot on. The other 10% it's burnt, cold and plastic. Still when it is good it's great.

This is one of those times where I wish I could give 3.5 stars.  I have to be honest this place is just cheap greasy pizza by the slice.  But its REALLY GOOD cheap greasy pizza also.  I came here a few times when I was in the mood for that as it reminded me of Giovanni's Pizza from my small home town that I ate when I was in middle school. Anytime that you only have a couple of bucks for lunch drop by for a slice and a soda, and look for a nickel and a penny on your walk here as I think the tax takes it a little over.

This place is like a bad relationship.  It may treat you like crap but you keep going back.  Why? Because it always keeps you guessing.  they may be rude on the phone or not, they may be rude in person when you pick it up or not, you maybe be waiting a while in the infernally hot yellowing restaurant or not...the pizza may be good or not...but like an unhealthy relationship you keep going back because when it's good, it's realllllly good.   We (my husband and I) have tried to leave Gigio's soooo many times but there's just not a better alternative for a thin crust, NY style pizza.

For east coast pizza in Chicago, this place is solid. I really dig it, floppy foldable slices with slightly greasy gooey cheese. It is VERY affordable as well. Good chewy dough with a snap in the crust, and the sauce compliments well. Limited on toppings, but east coast pizza really is rather utilitarian; the only toppings any place must offer are pepperoni, sausage, peppers, onions, and mushrooms, and that's exactly what they have . To be sure, this joint looks like the outside of a methadone clinic, so it'll be quite "an adventure" for those who live in the burbs (or yuppie areas like Lincoln Park). But don't worry, it's in a well populated area so there's no danger, even if you happen to stop by after midnight. That being said, if you live close, you'll probably want to take out, though if you live far eat there as fresh pizza really is best. All in all: solid.

Where else in Chicago can you get a pizza that is actually sliced?  This is our favorite go-to pizza place.  Our neighbor introduced us to them by sharing they had them on speed dial for many years!   I'm a yankee from way back and this is the closest to NY style I've found.  We always order delivery or pick it up.  The phone experience is right out of NY so don't expect much, it's part of the total experience!

The pizza was nasty. I didn't like it. I don't know what else to say. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it got to me fast at like 3am. I wouldn't order from them again.  Wait, that's not fair. I should list a valid reason. The cheese. The problem was the cheese.

This is our go-to pizza joint.  Its another Uptown gem.  The pizza is very good, fast, and the staff is remarkably personable (and willing to chat if you go in).  The only other thing I have to say is .... cheese fries ..... you must get them.  Something about soft fried fries with "nacho" cheese sauce always hits the spot.

As close as you can get to the real thing. NY style Pizza! If you love thin crust pizza, you should check this place, their pizza is amazing, almost the same as any pizzeria in New York. The Crust is a little bland, but you can fold it and that's the main idea.The ingredients are good and sauce and dough is excellent. $2+ for a slice, not bad! Atmosphere is really good.  I enjoy coming here after school. Get a plain slice grab a can of soda and dig in as watching by the window the neighborhood, people and sight. You will get some flashbacks from your times in New York's pizzerias and Neighborhoods. Got hungry, Im taking the -el- right now.....
Great thin crust slice- not as thin as NY caaaan be, but very good non the less! Less than desirable area so I would recommend going during daytime hours! We'll be back- great end of bike ride stop.

I love NY style pizza and so far, this is the only place I can think of in Chicago. The authenticity of the joint is great. Including people on crack outside and the dumpy looking placenear the "L"  but  I love it!  No frill, no thrills just Damm good NY style pizza that you can fold!  Last time I was there had to be around 10 years ago and it still looks like the old joint!  Slice for under 3 bucks is great!   I recommend you pick up and go! not really a plce to stay and eat unless you want to be watching your car every 5 seconds. Gigio's Pizza :  GAINED MY BUSINESS!!!!!!!!

The Pros:  Floppy new york style pizza Hot and gooey Not too greasy Really fast delivery Inexpensive The Cons: On the bland side Crust has some strange after taste that I did not enjoy. They put the pepperoni UNDER the cheese.  ( If you put the pepperoni on TOP of the cheese, then it has a chance to crisp up and taste divine!) I think that everyone has their own taste buds and I think that there are a lot of people who would really enjoy their pizza
I love Gigio's. Great NY style pizza, great prices, I like the folks that work there. But the place is a hole in the wall and you probably don't want to eat in during the summer.

Yes Yes Yes!  I am a Jersey girl, and ever since I moved to Chicago in 2005, I had yet to find a pizza place that truly tasted authentic to the NY/NJ style.  I just ordered delivery from them, and from the second that I looked at the pizza and smelled the aroma, I knew it was going to be good.  I have to say that this place hits the nail on the head, and it will be my go-to for delivery from now on.  It was a double-bonus that the medium pizzas happened to be on special, so the pizza + tax + delivery was only $11.99!! Way to go, Gigio's!

Solid NY style thin crust pizza.  This is one of my go-to joints when I need delivery, and I have tried many.  As noted by others, this isn't really a dine-in destination, but what it does, it does well.

I love New York style pizza, so when I saw this place on Chicago's Best, I had to go! I finally got my boyfriend to bring me all the way from Aurora to the northside of Chicago for this treat. Pulling up, the place looks like a dump (but I like dumps!) & not in the best part of the city (but, hey, I'm from Aurora so no need for snobbery..!). We get inside and order when a terrible thunderstorm hits. Just my luck, travel all the way to the northside from sunny Aurora, just to end up in a hailstorm w/ funnel clouds along the Lakefront....hmmm. After we get our pizza, we decided to skip the tiny, dirty booths and head to a park along Lakeshore Drive to watch the storm roll in. My bf had sausage and pepperoni and I had plain cheese. It was good, but a little too cheesy for NY style.  I would come here again...but maybe to the one in Des Plaines instead. The best part was eating our pizza in our car and watching the lightning rattle the Lakefront. The worst part- the drive. Oh well, maybe if we lived in the neighborhood...but thanks anyway Gigio's! :)

I have not been here for about 25 years. My parents use to bring me here a lot when I was a kid. I when back the place looks and smells the same. I LOVE IT. The pizza looks good taste good too. I must say's it was greasy but the fact that was so thin that made so good. They gave me a good size pizza for about $3.50 but the bad part you need to at least have 5 bucks to charge before you can put it credit card. I'm more than willing to go back.

The slice I recieved dripped into a pile of slop. The sweat dripping off the overweight slob working the register alone will prevent me from ever walking into that dump again.! Great place for a slice if you just got out of the penitentiary..!

Their, uh, "dining room" is nowhere that you would want to have a first date...or even a monthly check-in with your parole officer.  However, the pizza is fantastic and that's all that matters. This seems more dead-on New York style than their Evanston cousin, which I enjoyed regularly throughout the late 90s and early 00s, and more sporadically since.  This Gigio's serves you a greasy, cheesy slice with a nice, slight crisp on the outside of the crust from the second trip through the oven.  Sprinkle a little oregano, fold, and enjoy your bliss.

Oh Gigio's... I tried to give you another chance, figured I was way harsh and you didn't deserve the previous review but alas, you're just not that yummy. Ordered a large, sausage and spinach pizza. It looked soooo delicious, it looked gorgeous with it's dripping cheese, and golden brown crust from the oven but yeah... as bland as a heart healthy diet. No flavor! No seasonings! What gives? I don't like a lot of salt in my meals but damn, you need help developing a new recipe.  You're like a Michael Bay movie w/out the explosions... all pretty and exciting to look at but no substance, bland, and full of disappointment.

Gigio's offers the quintessential NY style pie; thin crust, greasy, and loaded with cheese.  DO NOT be put off by the decor, the fact that the employees are greasier than the pizza, or the drug deal happening outside...this is THE PLACE for all of your NY pizza needs.  Their other selections are on par with any other dive in the city, so don't bother.  Plus they are CHEAP!
A classic slice  in Chicago.  Good sausage. Real toppings. People in there are real and not on some bs.

My friends and I were heading to Truman college for facials in the cosmetology department. I also remember reading this review and looking up map quest. I really wanted to try this place and it was a coincidence that it was right by the college. And oh man!! You can't beat that 14 in 8 dollar pizza. NY style was very good and cheesy but they could really use remodeling on the inside and a better sweet tangy sauce. Would definitely go back!

I am a connoisseur of the finer things life such as art, music, and pizza. Gigio's Pizza...Hands down the BEST pizza I've ever had. In fact, it got to the point where I was ordering delivery 3 times a week and technically, I live beyond their delivery zone, so I pay a little extra to get my fix. It's well worth it!

New York Pizza in Chicago, doesn't get much better than that! This place is at good as it gets. Great NYC style pizza, even greater price! You can get a medium one topping pizza for $8. YES $8! When you get there, don't be fooled by there "NY" atittude, or how "charming" the place looks. Just don't plan on eating there anytime soon, unless your place looks worse. Just do order it and take it to go! Fresh toppings, fresh sauce, cheese, crust. What more can I tell u? $8 medium one topping NYC style pizza! JUST TRY IT! AND GET OUTTA MY FACE! FUHGETABOUTIT!

I am very obsessed with this place.   Even before tasting my slice of pizza, I immediately smelled the authenticity that this is indeed, NY style pizza.  Coming from NYC, I obviously love NY style but it's hard finding good ones here in Chicago.  The pizza took me back to my childhood when I would enjoy simple greasy slices of deliciousness.  The slice was instantly gobbled down.   An hour later (after we already went home), we came back and this time, didn't make the mistake of getting pizza by the slice but ordered the 14" pie for $8.  And for just only $8, it's indeed cheap eats.   One thing to note, the pizza by the slice was tastier than the pie...The crust on the slice was thinner and just tasted better so that was a bit odd.  The pie was still good but just not like the slice so I'm hoping that next time, my pie will be just like the slice.

Let's just say I wasn't blown away. For Chicago, it was a pretty good NY-style slice. They are not stingy at all with the toppings, I had pepperoni and sausage, but they're not exactly high quality toppings so that could be a good or bad thing. The cheese, crust, and sauce were all really good but the look of the pepp and saus just threw me, and the orange grease dripping from my slice was out of control. It was good, but not sure I'd go out of my way to go back for more.  Not exactly in the best part of town either...

Whenever I meet someone in Chicago I inevitably end up asking them their favorite pizza in the city. When I had someone mention Gigio's as their top choice I was suspect. However, being a pizza lover with an everyday pizza craving, I decided to try them.  oh.my .GOD.  Best pizza of my life. Obviously, making a statement that definitive, and that catastrophic, is much like deciding to have children, or taking your company public, or switching religions....you get the idea.....saying "it's the best" is monumental.  But this pizza IS THE BEST. Characterized by sweet cheese, really thin crust on the bottom and then doughy, thicker crust on the sides, with only a minimal amount of sauce, it's like God created this dough with his own hands.  God, do you live in Uptown?  If you love pizza, if you are looking for a new favorite place, or if you are hoping to prove me wrong, please try Gigio's. Say hi to God for me!

o.k heres an update....the crack heads are still hanging around, that good for me as i like to sit there and eat this goodness hot, since last time i bragged of these guys, thy racked up some awards, most place's would be pack from that, but good-old strange people keep the yuppie out...

I ordered a medium sausage and cheese pizza at the rave recommendation of friends.  The good: the pizza was REALLY good and the portions were big (seemed more like a large).  The bad: ordering/delivery. The girl who answered the phone was rude and seemed really annoyed that we were interrupting her day. We were told it would take an hour (which seems like a long time to wait for pizza, but we weren't in a hurry). It arrived after 75 minutes. The delivery man was not apologetic, but was, like the order taker, rude. As would be expected from exceedingly slow delivery, the pizza was cold.  I definitely want to try this again, as I've heard only good things. Next time I will try the pick up special ($8 for medium two topping!) and avoid the terrible service.
yummy pizza, cheap prices and fast service need i say more yummola

After seeing this place on Chicago's Best, I decided to check it out. Given, the place looks like a dive, but cmon, thats usually when food is at its best! I ordered a large pie w some friends and when it came out...we proceeded to demolish that thing! For the price, you can not beat their pizza! Thin, NY style pizza full of flavor on a nice thin crust, what more could you ask for! Now being Chicago born and raised, Im not completely biased to deep dish pizza. I believe in being a connoisseur of everything, whether it be pizza, burgers, or hot dogs and etc. If its good, its good! Dont be close minded! Sure we all have our preferences, but Im more flexible than most. If you havent had Gigios pizza, drop by and pick up a pie sometime

Gigio's is the only pizza worth buying in Chicago. I should explain that I'm an ex New Yorker with a loathing for these wierd tomato cheese pies they call pizza in this city. Gigio's is my savior and I count myself lucky to live in Uptown (best neighborhood in Chicago in my opinion to all you people who seem strangely put off by anything ungentrified or populated by immigrants). If this place were in Brooklyn or the lower east side it would be just another slice shop (which is to say a deeply satisfying if ubiquitous culinary experience) but the fact that its in Chicago makes it a unique, solitary hold out for the NY style pizza lover in the land of butter crusts and fat pies. Seriously, if I'm not eating Gigio's I'd rather just buy a frozen pizza at Jewel. I just don't get why Chicagoans are so proud of their universally nasty pizza (and I've now lived in Chicago longer than I lived in NYC). Thank you Gigio's! this was written by my boyfriend in my account...as i have never lived in new york...he should get his own account...but this still holds true as his opinion. although i do like chicago style pizza.

Sleazy pizza at it's best. I don't order for delivery, other wise I'd be waiting for a long a$$ time, I just order for pick up.  I wouldn't even call it "THIN CRUST". Just the best sleazy pizza you'll ever have.  P.S. if you go at the right time, when closing, you can walk away with two pizza's for the price of slice. Unless, I was just lucky enough and drunk enough for them to make me leave.  Nonetheless, the big man is awesome and once you get to know him and he tends to be a playboy. The ladies, in the hairnets, are actually sweet hearts. I do frequent there that much and about three coupons away from getting a free large pizza (gotta collect 20).

I'm a pizza folder and not at all a fan of the cracker-crust Chicago-style thin crust.  Gigio's pizza is straight-up NY style, and I love it's chewy, cheesy goodness.  Yes, it's a dive, but the pizza is so good it's worth it.  If you don't want to eat in, pick up or delivery are options.
Meh.  Three stars for being cheap and edible.  Otherwise, there is nothing exceptional about this place.

these reviews are funny and I support the facts that the place is a little beat up, but who cares??? the pizza is amazingly cheap and just right, u can get a 14 inch for 8 bucks. if ura scardy cat then dont go at night , or stop being a wuss and carry some mace just kidding maybe not??? :)

Eh it was a decent, though rather greasy pie.  I saw them featured on Chicago's Best thin pizza show so I decided to give it a try.  The place really is a dirty pizza joint, but that is what gives it character.  I went with the plain pie for $8 and took it to go.  I have to say I ate more than half of the pizza on the way home, which did little to help the cleanliness of my car.  I am sure I will go back someday and will probably try and get some toppings on it, but it was decent for a thin crust place.

This place is like straight out a NYC's skid row. Located off the Wilson Stop in a pretty grimmy part of uptown, you can not get as classic to the real city experience then this place. The place is a whole in the wall, very grundgy, but super cool. And the best thing about it is are the characters that work there, or are eating there. The dialouge coming out the place is ripe for a torentino movie or something. So we went there to pick up a pizza, and had to wait, and in 5 minutes there, we basically had a plot to a movie! The people working there were hilarious. You have the main manager who is this mildy retarded 500 pound Chicagoan dude, who is just bithching out his little old Italian delivery guy when we got in the door,  he was starting to get bothered by his constant peskering, "when is the pizza goanna be ready." In his Italian style, he starting yelling at this guy, he was like "GO take a walk, a jog, get out of my face., go take a walk around the counter.!" totally making a scene, for no reason, just to show that he was the boss. They also had this quasi-homeless guy working there, helping take out garbage and stuff. This guy was wearing battle fatigues and looked like he climbed out of the trash bin few hours prior. He had a flashlight tucked into the back of his pants. and was going around to the garbages, taking them out putting his whole leg in the garbage to compress it for more space. He did this about 3-4 times to the two garbages inside the place (it was so damn weird and pointless), while we were there, and we were scratching our heads. These two friends sitting accross from us were like "Look at this motha-fu*ka , hey, you need to come over here and put your foot in this mothafuc*kas ass, pointing to his friend, the both of them were laughing. as were we. What was funny, was the guy had a flashlight tucked in by his belt. Like he was somekid of superhero or something. So in this short 5 minutes we were there, there was so much happening, they were pretty busy.  We got the pizza, and it was delcious! and the experience of going there was so much fun. Oh yeah i forgot about the pizza! It was great! no complaints, best NYC pizza in Chi

DO NOT EAT INSIDE! Decent pizza, worse then horrible atmosphere. Yelling, swearing staff who gave me and my friend a migraine. If you still are considering this place, get it delivered or pick it up. I really can't believe how the staff was yelling the entire 30 minutes I was in the restaurant, and just how dirty the place was!  I never give bad reviews which shows how bad this place is. O yea I couldn't get any ketchup for my fries because they just ignored me at the counter. Lots of good pizza places in Chicago to chose from, do not go here.

This place is my guilty pleasure.... The pizza is excellent but the place is kinda crappy, especially in the summer, they never have air conditioning. The pizza is super thin, huge slices and cheap.  The place it self looks kinda dingy and unkept ...... Pizza still overrules every time ......

Let's get this out of the way. The pizza is good. OK. NEVER ORDER FROM GIGIO'S. THEY ARE UNRELIABLE AND REGARDLESS OF WHETHER A PIZZA IS TASTY, IF IT NEVER SHOWS UP THAT DOESN'T MATTER. Ordered a pizza at 6:30. Told it would take :45. Called at 7:30 and they apologized and said it was on the way. Called at 7:50 and after some phone shuffling and pointed questions was told that it despite what they had said, it had not in fact left when I originally called (an hour after ordering). I'm happy they were unexpectedly busy on a Tuesday night. It doesn't excuse leaving me or my family (including 6- and 7-year olds) waiting twice as long as promised or asking me what would make it right and then saying no. Suck it up. Give us the pizza gratis (after an hour and a half and two phone calls) and keep a customer happy. THEY ARE LIARS WHO DON't PARTICULARLY CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS.  MY ADVICE, WHICH I WILL LOUDLY COMMUNICATE FROM NOW ON. DO NOT ORDER FROM GIGIO'S.

They're aiming to recreate NY-Style Pizza and I'd say they get it right on.  I'm always confused by the people who have such a specific definition of NY pizza.  I've been to 20 pizza places in NY and they're all similar, but some are definitely better than others.  If you're looking for something specific, go to the place that makes it that way, but if you're looking for NY-style pizza that tastes good, Gigio's gets it right.  The crust is floppy and foldable, the cheese is stretchy and the tomato sauce is sweet but not cloying.  Fast delivery, reasonable price, they accomplish the goals they set out for themselves.  They even have NY-style attitude when they answer the phone, not that I care for that.

Great New York style pizza. Sausage only in my opinion , cheese is ok it just loses some flavor. The meatball sandwiches are a great deal as well .  Only problem I have with the place is that in summer its like sauna inside. Better to order your food ahead of time then wait inside during the summer months .  Not your sit-down and eat kinda of pizza place . Carryout or delivery only . Delivery is pretty fast if you live close by .  Must give it a try , you are missing out on some good food; especially the pizza .

Not for the squeemish... I lived in the neighborhood for 30 years, and Gigios always made great pizza.  I love Chicago style pizza, but Gigio's is different.  It is thin and crisp -- as if it was made on matzo.  I could eat a whole one myself. If you are looking for spotless tables in a fine neighborhood, with plenty of parking --- you won't like this place.

Not bad for thin crust east coast style pizza. Especially for the price. I'll walk over here or have them deliver and when it's hot, it's pretty good. Can't beat a large pizza for 8 bucks! Great for hangovers, or when you're drunk, but never good reheated. I recommend going in and eating there just to experience the melting pot of crackwhores, yuppies, homeless and crazies. What a show!

Is this what New York pizza is all about? If so, I never want NY style pizza! This place was not all it's cracked up to be. I was so excited due to the rave reviews it's gotten, and not to mention it's so cheap. But I was so disappointed! I consider myself a pizza aficionado so it killed me to not like this place. Due to the cheap prices I'd probably be willing to give it another shot, but I was very disappointed.

I didn't get it. The delivery driver was very nice, and the pizza came to my door very quickly, but the pizza was just OK. I didn't get any meat on it (just veggies) I'm suspecting that's part of the magic(?).

Damnit.  All those years wasting away in Uptown and somehow I never stumbled into this spot.  Maybe the constant stream of vagrants and bums kept me out, but man, I should have know.  Probably my new favorit 'Za spot in Chicago right now.  The hand tossed and homemade crust is really what made it for me.  Don't let the greasy pizzeria facade fool you.  This is legit pie.  They say it's NY style, but I still thought it had more of a Neapolitan crust with American ingredients.  The sausage was really good and obviously homemade.  Oh and the price was right....medium pizza's are $8.  A damn good deal.  I'll be back very soon.
the bomb! NY pizza beats the chicago cake!
